question: Is Tilavonemab effective for progressive supranuclear palsy?
ideal_answer: No. Tilavonemab is not effective for progressive supranuclear palsy.

snippets.text: INTERPRETATION: A similar safety profile was seen in all treatment groups. No beneficial treatment effects were recorded. Although this study did not provide evidence of efficacy in progressive supranuclear palsy, the findings provide potentially useful information for future investigations of passive immunisation using tau antibodies for progressive supranuclear palsy.
